{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:12.440
    | text      = So this next clip, Alex talks a little bit more about this, and it led me to the realization
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:18.220
    | text      = that I need to have a little chat with you about a method of lying and a method of analysis
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:24.720
    | text      = that Alex does that I haven't been clear enough about in the past.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:29.019
    | text      = This is Bloomberg.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:31.099
    | text      = Researchers retract study linking malaria pill to heart risk.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:35.240
    | text      = The entire study, Lancet reports, is a complete and total hoax funded by Bill Gates.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:41.539
    | text      = That's amazing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:43.500
    | text      = Oh, boy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:45.660
    | text      = So the words hoax and Bill Gates appear nowhere in the Lancet article, nor in the Business
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:49.539
    | text      = Insider article that Alex is claiming to report on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:52.579
    | text      = He's just making that up because he doesn't care to understand the actual story and just
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:55.660
    | text      = wants to make things fit into his predetermined narrative.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:59.099
    | text      = This is important because Alex is directly asserting that Lancet is reporting that the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:03.619
    | text      = study is a total hoax and was funded by Bill Gates.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:06.819
    | text      = That statement is a lie, but I want to take this opportunity to discuss what Alex is actually
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:11.339
    | text      = doing here.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:12.339
    | text      = When I was in college, I was drawn toward the study of ancient things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:16.059
    | text      = I dabbled in anthropology and religious studies before I landed on the possibly ill-advised
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:21.019
    | text      = path I ended up taking, where I have a degree with basically four minors instead of one
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:25.140
    | text      = major.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:26.140
    | text      = This is the cost of being indecisive.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:27.960
    | text      = You end up having to start a podcast about Alex Jones when you grow up because you can't
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:31.779
    | text      = get hired anywhere else.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:32.779
    | text      = Yeah, there is that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:34.779
    | text      = Not the best plan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:35.819
    | text      = My advisor in college did not warn me of this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:38.460
    | text      = At the time, I kind of thought, like, I'm going to be a famous stand-up, so who gives
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:42.220
    | text      = a shit?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:43.220
    | text      = Where's the whiskey?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:44.220
    | text      = You know, it was not.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:45.220
    | text      = I wasn't very smart.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:46.220
    | text      = I just imagine my high school guidance counselor using our story as like a cautionary tale.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:52.220
    | text      = Do you want to start a podcast about a lunatic?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:54.740
    | text      = Do you?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:55.740
    | text      = Where people tell you not to get sugar gliders.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:59.980
    | text      = So in the course of my religious studies classes, I was introduced to the concepts of exegesis
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:04.299
    | text      = and eisegesis, which are two styles of textual criticism.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:08.380
    | text      = Someone who engages in exegesis attempts to understand the text that's in front of them
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:12.480
    | text      = and understand that text through a number of applied contexts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:16.440
    | text      = Some work through the prism of understanding the text in terms of historical events happening
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:20.000
    | text      = around the time of the text's writing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:22.480
    | text      = Another school of exegesis views the text itself as divinely inspired and thus studies
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:27.259
    | text      = the text in the context that there's a meaning beyond what the original author intended,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:31.740
    | text      = but it's still a study of the text.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:34.299
    | text      = There are a lot of different views on exegesis, but all of it is studying within a framework,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:38.240
    | text      = and all of it relies on pulling things from the text to study.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:42.539
    | text      = The opposite of this practice is called eisegesis, which is when it's something that serious
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:47.980
    | text      = scholars advise against strongly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:51.119
    | text      = Someone who engages in eisegesis is someone who approaches a text for a reason, and they're
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:55.740
    | text      = seeking to find something that demonstrates a conclusion they already have.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:59.960
    | text      = In exegesis, you rely on things you take out of the text to inform your study, whereas
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:04.599
    | text      = in eisegesis, you're encountering the text with a point already in mind and are bringing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:09.559
    | text      = that point to the text itself to defend your point.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:12.839
    | text      = It's a dangerous practice, because it allows you to misuse primary sources and take small
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:17.059
    | text      = passages out of appropriate context to make whatever point you're inclined to make anyway,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:21.740
    | text      = but you're pretending that you're engaging with source material, and that's what led
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:25.380
    | text      = you to your conclusion.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:27.859
    | text      = It's a bastardized version of studying.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:29.779
    | text      = Are you sure they  -  see, because what I hear is that one of those is exegesis, and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:35.180
    | text      = one of those is phono-jesus.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:36.180
    | text      = Probably.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:37.180
    | text      = It probably is way more fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:38.180
    | text      = Have a great time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:39.180
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:40.180
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:41.180
    | text      = Come on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:42.180
    | text      = I like believing what I believe and not worrying about what other people say.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:44.819
    | text      = I will say that in my life, things that are disciplined are typically less fun, which
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:50.980
    | text      = is why I have four minors instead of a major.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:55.380
    | text      = So exegesis and eisegesis are terms that are typically used in relation to biblical criticism,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:00.539
    | text      = but the same methods apply to basically all sorts of textual analysis.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:05.420
    | text      = Alex is a person who engages in rampant eisegesis.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:08.740
    | text      = He has a point that he intends to make, and he picks various headlines that he thinks
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:12.779
    | text      = will reinforce his points, as opposed to reading the news and forming conclusions based on
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:17.019
    | text      = the information that comes to him about reality.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:20.220
    | text      = A lot of conspiracy-minded people do this, since eisegesis is a practice that essentially
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:24.779
    | text      = is just a path to confirmation bias.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:27.579
    | text      = You go looking for something, and if you're lazy enough of a researcher, you'll probably
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:31.359
    | text      = find exactly what you're looking for, but there's a decent chance it won't be real.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:36.740
    | text      = That's what I'm seeing happen here with this news story that Alex is covering.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:40.000
    | text      = He's already decided that everything about COVID-19 is a hoax, so he's bringing that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:43.539
    | text      = to his reading of this story, when the actual text in no way supports his conclusions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:48.059
    | text      = The only way he could arrive at that conclusion is for him to bring that conclusion to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:51.859
    | text      = text with him, which is inappropriate.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:55.079
    | text      = Alex does this all the time, and I generally just say he's lying or making things up, but
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:58.740
    | text      = I thought this was a particularly good example of his specific behavior, so I wanted to spend
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:02.579
    | text      = a little bit more time explaining this precise technique that he uses.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:07.279
    | text      = When you understand this a little bit better, you can see it pop up in so many instances
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:12.200
    | text      = with Alex.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:13.200
    | text      = It's a very regular technique that, if he'd actually learned things in his younger years
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:18.940
    | text      = about how to engage with different texts differently, he probably wouldn't fall into...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:25.380
    | text      = I don't even want to call it fall into.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:28.019
    | text      = It's so intentional.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:31.019
    | text      = Ice of Jesus isn't necessarily bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:33.619
    | text      = You can use it, that sort of thing, in terms of engaging with poetry or a lot of...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:41.920
    | text      = Even creative non-fiction type texts, they rely on the reader bringing something to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:47.140
    | text      = text to engage with.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:50.019
    | text      = It's the form that is more appropriate for those genres.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:54.940
    | text      = But when you're talking about reporting or you're talking about factual-based things
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:01.140
    | text      = or primary sources and documents, it's just a wildly irresponsible thing to engage in.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:07.380
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:08.380
    | text      = As somebody who's gone to five colleges and still doesn't even have a single degree, most
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:15.339
    | text      = of those were all in literature.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:17.619
    | text      = That conversation in so many different classes about authorial intent versus...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:23.859
    | text      = There were always some people who were in any of those classes just like, I refuse to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:29.579
    | text      = even bother picking up a history book about what was going on around this time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:35.299
    | text      = What he was obviously writing about was whatever it is that I wished he was writing about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:40.019
    | text      = It happened every time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:42.819
    | text      = To an extent, that can be a valid way to engage with poetry and fiction and those sorts of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:48.900
    | text      = things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:49.900
    | text      = But it's also a different path than looking at a piece of even fiction within the context
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:56.019
    | text      = of when the author was writing it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:57.720
    | text      = What could things be allegories for based on the lived experience of the author?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:03.019
    | text      = It's a different approach to it, and typically, especially when you're covering topics that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:10.099
    | text      = are similar to the ones Alex is, eisegesis is just a completely inappropriate and flawed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:16.539
    | text      = way to engage with material.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:19.420
    | text      = You're going to end up lying intentionally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:23.339
    | text      = You're going to end up lying unintentionally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = that his gigantic vocabulary was failing him and he was just making up the definition of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:41:52.380
    | text      = an oligarchy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:41:53.840
    | text      = If you consult Merriam-Webster, the definition of oligarchy is quote, government by the few,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:41:58.779
    | text      = which is kind of the opposite of mob rule.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:00.979
    | text      = What happened here is that Alex didn't realize he was actually reading the definition of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:04.739
    | text      = the word ochlocracy until he was halfway through it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:08.420
    | text      = And then he just decided to cover his tracks by saying, it goes on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:11.819
    | text      = It's an easy mistake to make when you don't prepare and you're just talking out of your
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:15.020
    | text      = ass.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:16.020
    | text      = I mean, those two words do look similar.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:17.140
    | text      = They both start with an O and they end with a Y, which basically means they're the same
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:20.500
    | text      = thing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:21.500
    | text      = I tried to figure out exactly what happened here and I did get to the bottom of this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:25.979
    | text      = Alex is just reading the definition of ochlocracy from the top of its Wikipedia page and he
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:30.380
    | text      = must have realized that he had the wrong word in the middle of it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:32.939
    | text      = Jesus Christ.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:33.939
    | text      = As someone who studied ancient Greek in college, I'd be remiss if I didn't point out that the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:38.260
    | text      = ends of these two words are a sure sign that they're different.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:43.460
    | text      = Ochlocracy ends in krasi, which comes from the Greek kratos.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:46.979
    | text      = You find this root word in democracy or aristocracy or theocracy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:51.619
    | text      = It means power in Greek, which is reflected in each of these terms of social structures.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:42:57.840
    | text      = Democracy is where the kratos, or power, is rooted in the demos, or the people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:02.880
    | text      = Aristocracy has the power in the aristos, or the excellent, meaning the power lies in
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:07.500
    | text      = the hands of the elite.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:10.380
    | text      = Theocracy is where power is rooted in the idea of theos, or God, so you end up developing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:14.439
    | text      = a system where the rule of God controls society.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:17.539
    | text      = Conversely, oligarchy ends in archi, which comes from the word arco, which means to rule.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:23.779
    | text      = Words that end in archi typically reflect the type of rulers there are in a system.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:28.579
    | text      = Oligarchy comes from oligos, which translates to the few.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:32.060
    | text      = It's just descriptive of a system where the few rule the many.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:36.020
    | text      = Aristocracy, meritocracy, or theocracy are subsets of oligarchic systems, because the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:40.899
    | text      = rule of the few can take many different forms, depending on how the few is defined in a particular
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:46.779
    | text      = society.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:47.779
    | text      = All right, big word book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:48.779
    | text      = Alex has a big vocabulary too, Dan, just because he doesn't know other languages.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:53.500
    | text      = Who even speaks Greek anymore?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:54.899
    | text      = These are English words.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:55.899
    | text      = Who even speaks English words anymore, Dan?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:57.739
    | text      = They're too big.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:43:58.739
    | text      = Those are like four pages of word, is what you're doing right now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:02.979
    | text      = Other examples of this linguistic pattern are anarchy, or the absence of a ruler.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:08.060
    | text      = There's demarchy, which is a system where rulers and officials are selected from a random
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:12.500
    | text      = sampling of the population, making it more of a system where the ruler, the arco, is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:17.220
    | text      = in the hand of the demos, the people, demarchy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:20.340
    | text      = Monarchy is the system where there is power in the hands of an individual.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:22.779
    | text      = You can go on and on with this line if you want to break down more stuff in words, but
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:27.140
    | text      = it's an important thing to remember that words mean things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:30.340
    | text      = When a system is described using kratos or krasi, it's discussing where the power derives
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:36.140
    | text      = from.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:37.140
    | text      = In democracy, the source of power is the people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:39.460
    | text      = In theocracy, it's God.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:40.939
    | text      = In ochlocracy, it's the mob, or in Greek, ochlos, which is a derisive term for a crowd
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:46.460
    | text      = or the rabble.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:48.239
    | text      = When a system is described with a word ending in arco, or in English, archy, it's describing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:53.460
    | text      = who actually is in a power position.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:44:56.579
    | text      = Monarchy has a few in positions of power, monarchy has the king or queen in a position
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:01.260
    | text      = of power, and anarchy has no one in a position of power.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:04.380
    | text      = This is a very basic linguistic distinction that anyone with any grasp on language or
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:08.539
    | text      = political science should understand.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:10.699
    | text      = It's staggering to imagine that Alex has been pretending to study political systems for
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:14.619
    | text      = twenty plus years, and he doesn't grasp this very elementary thing about how political
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:18.840
    | text      = systems are described.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:20.399
    | text      = It's really fucking sad, and probably not as sad as him pretending to know the definition
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:23.859
    | text      = of oligarchy, then reading the Wikipedia page for ochlocracy, realizing he makes a mistake
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:28.960
    | text      = mid-definition, then bailing while pretending he was right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:32.380
    | text      = That's a pathetic level of disregard for accuracy, and honestly not very surprising for Alex.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:37.359
    | text      = That's just comically bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:45:38.739
    | text      = This is the sort of thing that I would love for anyone who's curious about Alex, or someone
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:46:48.380
    | text      = If you understand it, it helps you understand what things mean, and Alex can't even recognize

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
